title: Practical Implementation of Transfer Learning and Data Augmentation for Medical Image Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Python programming and foundational deep learning concepts
context.additional_context: Practice-centered training to develop competencies in image processing techniques and classification model design reflecting medical data characteristics

learning_goals: Within six months, learners can implement a transfer learning-based medical image classification model using ResNet50 and VGG-16, achieve over 85% accuracy (Top-1) on public medical image datasets (e.g., CheXpert, MIMIC-CXR), and submit a model performance comparison analysis report.

Within six months, learners can practice improving model accuracy by over 15% on small image datasets (<500 images) by applying data augmentation techniques (rotation, resizing, color transformation) and preprocessing (noise removal, contrast enhancement, edge detection) and submit a report.
Accuracy optimization via integration of SVM classifiers and deep learning models, along with k-fold cross-validation.
Analysis and interpretation of performance metrics (accuracy, sensitivity, AUC, etc.) for medical image classification models.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
